content.title: Deep Vein Thrombosis Classification
content.definition: Classification systems for deep vein thrombosis based on anatomic location, acuity, and clinical severity.

concepts.definition: DVT classified by location: distal (calf veins), proximal (popliteal and above), and iliofemoral.

clinical_features.clinical_significance: Proximal DVT has higher PE risk and requires treatment

concepts.definition: DVT classified by duration since symptom onset.
Severe forms of DVT with limb-threatening venous outflow obstruction.

clinical_features.wells_criteria: Clinical prediction score for DVT probability
clinical_features.d_dimer: Negative D-dimer rules out DVT in low probability
